intro: Lepismium chrysocarpum, commonly known as the golden fruit lily, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its showy, fragrant flowers that bloom in shades of white, yellow, and pink. The plant produces distinctive yellow berries that are edible and have a tart flavor. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Lepismium chrysocarpum is relatively low maintenance and can be grown in shaded garden beds or as a houseplant.
